comments.body: These `dict.pop()` calls reset `app.bag_dag`’s state across tests so it can be re-populated for new things to test. An alternative fix is to use a different DAG ID for each test, which generates a larger diff, and probably slightly slower (DAGs created here need to be sync-ed into the db, so more DAG IDs = more db inserts; I didn’t actually benchmark this though).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +114,118 @@        dag = DAG(self.DAG_ID, start_date=timezone.parse(self.default_time))
        dag.sync_to_db()
        dagbag.dags.pop(self.DAG_ID, None)
        dagbag.bag_dag(dag=dag, root_dag=dag)
        with create_session() as session:
